datasource.description: Enable to include datasource information for each linked object.

count.description: Maximum number of entries to return.

skip_to.description: Skip to Nth CMDB entry. Only collect statistical data after it.

with_meta.description: Enable to include meta information about each object (type id, references, etc).

with_contents_hash.description: Enable to include a checksum of each object's contents.

skip.description: Enable to call CLI skip operator to hide skipped properties.

format.description: List of property names to include in results, separated by | (i.e. policyid|srcintf).

filter.description:
Filtering multiple key/value pairs
Operator     |   Description
==     |   Case insensitive match with pattern.
!=     |    Does not match with pattern (case insensitive).
=@     |    Pattern found in object value (case insensitive).
!@     |    ﻿Pattern not﻿ found in object value (case insensitive).
<=     |    Value must be less than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
<     |    Value must be less than pattern﻿.
.>=    |    Value must be greater than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
.>     |    Value must be greater than ﻿pattern﻿.
Logical OR    |    Separate filters using commas ','
Logical AND    |    Filter strings can be combined to create logical AND queries by including multiple filters in the request.
Combining AND and OR    |    You can combine AND and OR filters together to create more complex filters.

key.description: If present, objects will be filtered on property with this name.

pattern.description: If present, objects will be filtered on property with this value.

datasource_format.description: A map of datasources to a string of attributes, separated by | (ie: policyid|srcintf). If specified, this will add the attributes listed for any linked objects.

unfiltered_count.description: Maximum number of unfiltered entries to interate through.

stat-items.description: Items to count occurrence in entire response (multiple items should be separated by '|').

primary_keys.description: The primary key to find indexes for.

action.description:
default: Return the CLI default values for entire CLI tree.
meta: Return meta data for a specific object, table, or the entire CLI tree.
json-schema: Return JSON Schema for entire CLI tree.
schema: Return schema for entire CLI tree.

vdom.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

action.description:
If supported, an action can be specified.
_move_: Move this specific resource.
When *action=move* is set, one of the extra parameters (*before*, *after*) must be provided.
__*Note:*__ If this parameter is provided when not supported, the action will be ignored and an “invalid request” error will be returned.

before.description:
If *action=move*, use *before* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved before.
For example, to move `object 1` to before `object 2`, use:
__action=move&before=2__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

after.description:
If *action=move*, use *after* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved after.
For example, to move `object 1` to after `object 3`, use:
__action=move&after=3__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

scope.description:
Specify the Scope from which results are returned or changes are applied to. Objects are only existed in VDOMs scope.
scope=vdom

vdom.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

scope.description:
Specify the Scope from which results are returned or changes are applied to. Objects are only existed in VDOMs scope.
scope=vdom

vdom.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

action.description:
If supported, an action can be specified.
_clone_: Clone this specific resource.
When *action=clone* is set, the extra parameters *nkey* must be provided.
__*Note:*__ If this parameter is provided when not supported, the action will be ignored and an “invalid request” error will be returned.

nkey.description:
If *action=clone*, use *nkey* to specify the ID for the new resource to be created.
For example, to clone `address1` to `address1_clone`, use:
__action=clone&nkey=address1_clone__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *clone*.

scope.description:
Specify the Scope from which results are returned or changes are applied to. Objects are only existed in VDOMs scope.
scope=vdom

GET.summary:
Select all entries in a CLI table.
 Access Group: utmgrp

POST.summary:
Create object(s) in this table.
 Access Group: utmgrp

PUT.summary:
Update this specific resource.
 Access Group: utmgrp

DELETE.summary:
Delete this specific resource.
 Access Group: utmgrp

options.name: options
options.help: FortiGuard DNS filter options.

options.name: error-allow
options.help: Allow all domains when FortiGuard DNS servers fail.
options.label: Error Allow

options.name: ftgd-disable
options.help: Disable FortiGuard DNS domain rating.
options.label: Ftgd Disable

action.name: action
action.help: Action to take for DNS requests matching the category.

options.name: block
options.help: Block DNS requests matching the category.
options.label: Block

options.name: monitor
options.help: Allow DNS requests matching the category and log the result.
options.label: Monitor

log.name: log
log.help: Enable/disable DNS filter logging for this DNS profile.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable DNS filter logging.
options.label: Enable

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable DNS filter logging.
options.label: Disable

log-all-domain.name: log-all-domain
log-all-domain.help: Enable/disable logging of all domains visited (detailed DNS logging).

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable logging of all domains visited.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable logging of all domains visited

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable logging of all domains visited.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable logging of all domains visited

sdns-ftgd-err-log.name: sdns-ftgd-err-log
sdns-ftgd-err-log.help: Enable/disable FortiGuard SDNS rating error logging.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable FortiGuard SDNS rating error logging.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable FortiGuard SDNS rating error logging

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable FortiGuard SDNS rating error logging.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable FortiGuard SDNS rating error logging

sdns-domain-log.name: sdns-domain-log
sdns-domain-log.help: Enable/disable domain filtering and botnet domain logging.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable domain filtering and botnet domain logging.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable domain filtering and botnet domain logging

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable domain filtering and botnet domain logging.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable domain filtering and botnet domain logging

block-action.name: block-action
block-action.help: Action to take for blocked domains.

options.name: block
options.help: Return NXDOMAIN for blocked domains.
options.label: Block

options.name: redirect
options.help: Redirect blocked domains to SDNS portal.
options.label: Redirect
options.description: Redirect blocked domains to SDNS portal

options.name: block-sevrfail
options.help: Return SERVFAIL for blocked domains.
options.label: Block Sevrfail

redirect-portal.name: redirect-portal
redirect-portal.help: IPv4 address of the SDNS redirect portal.

redirect-portal6.name: redirect-portal6
redirect-portal6.help: IPv6 address of the SDNS redirect portal.

block-botnet.name: block-botnet
block-botnet.help: Enable/disable blocking botnet C&C DNS lookups.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable blocking botnet C&C DNS lookups.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable blocking botnet C&C DNS lookups

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable blocking botnet C&C DNS lookups.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable blocking botnet C&C DNS lookups

safe-search.name: safe-search
safe-search.help: Enable/disable Google, Bing, YouTube, Qwant, DuckDuckGo safe search.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable Google, Bing, YouTube, Qwant, DuckDuckGo safe search.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable Google, Bing, YouTube, Qwant, DuckDuckGo safe search

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable Google, Bing, YouTube, Qwant, DuckDuckGo safe search.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable Google, Bing, YouTube, Qwant, DuckDuckGo safe search

youtube-restrict.name: youtube-restrict
youtube-restrict.help: Set safe search for YouTube restriction level.

options.name: strict
options.help: Enable strict safe seach for YouTube.
options.label: Strict
options.description: Enable strict safe seach for YouTube

options.name: moderate
options.help: Enable moderate safe search for YouTube.
options.label: Moderate
options.description: Enable moderate safe search for YouTube

options.name: none
options.help: Disable safe search for YouTube.
options.label: None

external-ip-blocklist.name: external-ip-blocklist
external-ip-blocklist.help: One or more external IP block lists.

options.name: ipv4
options.help: IPv4 address type.
options.label: Ipv4

options.name: ipv6
options.help: IPv6 address type.
options.label: Ipv6

src.name: src
src.help: IPv4 address or subnet on the internal network to compare with the resolved address in DNS query replies. If the resolved address matches, the resolved address is substituted with dst.

dst.name: dst
dst.help: IPv4 address or subnet on the external network to substitute for the resolved address in DNS query replies. Can be single IP address or subnet on the external network, but number of addresses must equal number of mapped IP addresses in src.

netmask.name: netmask
netmask.help: If src and dst are subnets rather than single IP addresses, enter the netmask for both src and dst.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable this DNS translation.
options.label: Enable

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable this DNS translation.
options.label: Disable

src6.name: src6
src6.help: IPv6 address or subnet on the internal network to compare with the resolved address in DNS query replies. If the resolved address matches, the resolved address is substituted with dst6.

dst6.name: dst6
dst6.help: IPv6 address or subnet on the external network to substitute for the resolved address in DNS query replies. Can be single IP address or subnet on the external network, but number of addresses must equal number of mapped IP addresses in src6.

prefix.name: prefix
prefix.help: If src6 and dst6 are subnets rather than single IP addresses, enter the prefix for both src6 and dst6 (1 - 128, default = 128).

strip-ech.name: strip-ech
strip-ech.help: Enable/disable removal of the encrypted client hello service parameter from supporting DNS RRs.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable removal of the encrypted client hello service parameter from supporting DNS RRs.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable removal of the encrypted client hello service parameter from supporting DNS RRs

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable removal of the encrypted client hello service parameter from supporting DNS RRs.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable removal of the encrypted client hello service parameter from supporting DNS RRs
